newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine eyes Sept $250-$300 mln Japan bond launch.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine eyes Sept $250-$300 mln Japan bond launch.

text.p: Ukraine plans to issue $250-$300 million worth of bonds in Japan in September, First Deputy Finance Minister Mykhailo Honcharuk said on Tuesday.

"We intend to launch the issue, and to make our first money, at the beginning of September," Honcharuk told Reuters. The bonds would be worth $250-$300 million, he said. Officials have declined to say in what currency the bonds would be denominated.

Honcharuk said rating agencies, issuing agencies and banks had been approved in principle by the ministry. "Legal firms in Ukraine and Japan are working on agreements and I think next week they will be given to the government for approval."
He did not name the firms involved in the deal, but said the issue would be a public placement. "The most important thing for us is getting a credit rating," Honcharuk said.
Ukraine's parliament is expected to approve the 1997 budget, crucial to obtaining a rating, by the end of June.
Honcharuk said Ukraine was already studying its next step on international markets, the issue of a bond in Europe.
